pageTitle: Which education career is right for you?

quizSection.title: Take Our Free Education Career Quiz to Find Out
quizSection.content:
Are you a teacher looking to stay in education but leave the classroom? Maybe you’re ready to advance your current education career? Or are you in a different field but want to apply your skills to helping shape the future?

If you want to work in education but you don’t know which job fits your skills and interests, this free quiz can help find a good fit and you plan your next steps.

The Bureau of Labor Statistics predicts nearly 900 thousand jobs in education will be created each year over the next decade. Many colleges and universities offer flexible, affordable degrees or certificates that can help you get a head start in transferring your skills to a new or more advanced role.

In less than three minutes, you could discover which type of education career could be a good fit for you. We’ll also connect you with schools near you that offer degrees to help you reach your goals.

whyChoose.title: 5 Good Answers to the Question:
whyChoose.subTitle: Why Become a Teacher?
whyChoose.description: Teaching is more than just a job; it's a calling that makes a real difference in the world. For those pondering a career in education, here are five compelling reasons to take the plunge into teaching.

reasons.title: Inspire Future Generations
reasons.description: Teaching gives you the chance to impact the lives of students, inspiring and guiding future generations. As a teacher, you become a role model, shaping young minds and sparking curiosity about the world.

reasons.title: Make a Societal Impact
reasons.description: Teachers play a pivotal role in shaping society. By educating the youth, you contribute to the development of informed, thoughtful, and responsible citizens, making a lasting impact on the community and the world at large.

reasons.title: Get Creative and Intellectual Stimulation
reasons.description: Teaching is an intellectually stimulating career that constantly challenges you to be creative in lesson planning and finding ways to engage diverse learners. It's a field that keeps you learning and growing professionally.

reasons.title: Building Relationships and Community
reasons.description: As a teacher, you become part of a larger community of educators, students, and families. These relationships are rewarding and enriching, offering a sense of belonging and the joy of working collaboratively towards educational goals.

reasons.title: Career Flexibility and Security
reasons.description: The demand for qualified teachers makes teaching a career with great job security. Furthermore, teaching skills are transferable worldwide, offering flexibility in where you can work – whether it's different states, countries, or educational settings.

testimonial.text: If you look behind every exceptional person there is an exceptional teacher.
testimonial.author: Stephen Hawking

rightCareer.title: Top 5 Reasons a Career in Health Care Could Be Right for You
rightCareer.description: Teachers have a diverse skill set that opens doors to many career opportunities, both within and outside traditional classroom settings. Here are some good career options for teachers:

reasons.title: Educational Consultant
reasons.description: Advising schools, educational organizations, or publishers on curriculum development, teaching strategies, and educational technologies.

reasons.title: Curriculum Developer or Instructional Designer
reasons.description: Designing and revising curriculum, developing instructional materials, and training teachers on new content or teaching methods.

reasons.title: School Administrator
reasons.description: Roles like principal or vice-principal, focusing on managing school operations, staff, and policies.

reasons.title: Educational Policy Analyst
reasons.description: Working with governmental agencies, non-profits, or think tanks to analyze, develop, and implement educational policies.

reasons.title: Instructional Designer
reasons.description: Creating educational content and courses, particularly for online platforms or corporate training programs.

reasons.title: Academic Advisor or Counselor
reasons.description: Helping students navigate their educational paths, including course selection, career advice, and personal development.

rightCareer.endCopy: The Education Career Quiz can help you discover how your particular interests and skills can translate to careers like these!
